summary: Adds a Dragonscale patterned Hood and Cape that matches the Dragonscale Armor.
descriptionHtml:
MAJOR UPDATE: Dragonscale Hood is FINALLY stanadalone, craftable, upgradable, and enchantable!!!!   Thanks to hucifer on the Nexus forums for taking a look and helping me out!!!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I made this because I don\'t like the look of the vanilla Dragonscale helm so I retextured a couple hoods to match the Dragonscale set.

This works with both males and females of all races.

There are 2 variants of the hood. One with a scarf (Monk Hood) and one without. 
Both Hoods can be crafted at any Forge, and can be found under the Dragon category.
There is also a separate version for Khajiits and Argonians, they will called Dragonscale Cape (Beast) and Dragonscale Hood (Beast). 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
NOTES: 
There may still be some clipping, but I believe I fixed most of the major issues.

Currently there is no ground model for the hoods, so if you drop them in the game world they will disappear. This is the first thing I will fix this once the CS comes out! So until then, don\'t drop them from your inventory! 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CHANGES:

Jan 9th: Added an alternate version that uses the Monk Hood mesh
            Fixed the file paths.

Jan 16th: 
-Combined the Hood and Cape versions, made them standalone and craftable/upgradable/enchantable.
- Patched the .esp to fix clipping hair
-Added a version for beast races

Jan. 22th:
-Improved the Hood textures
-Small change to the .esp, Now requires Dragon Armor smithing perk to craft the Hoods.

Jan. 23rd
- Added a Heavy Armor version (temporary until I decide on how to make the new textures)

Jan. 25th:
-Added a Cloth version
-Added recipes for the Heavy and Cloth version

Feb 7th
-Added World Models
-Fixed an issue where the hoods wouldn\'t display on orcs.

Feb. 12th
- Fixed issue where Hoods where no longer showing up to craft in the forge.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

How to Install:

Extract the .ESP, Meshes and Textures folders into:

c: > Program Files/Program Files (x86) > Steam > steamapps > common > skyrim > Data

Check the Dragonscale hood.esp in the Launcher or with NMM.


Uninstall:

Delete the Dragonscale hood.esp and \'dragonscalehood\' folder from both the Meshes and Textures > \'armor\' folder in the Skyrim Data folder.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Where to Find:

Both Variants can be crafted at any forge. You must have the Dragon Armor perk to craft them.

You can also open the console by pressing the \"~\" key and typing \'help dragonscale 0 . the additem codes should be the last 4 entries that pop up. Then type player.additem <code> <amount you want> to get them.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tools Used:
SkyEdit
BSAopt
Nifskope
Adobe Photoshop CS5


Thanks and Credit to:
Bethesda Game Studios
Nexus users for the feedback and downloads! <3
